articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Delegation of Koreans in Japan
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Delegation of Koreans in Japan
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, met and had a talk with the delegation of Koreans in Japan headed by Kwon Sun Hwi, advisor of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Monday.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Discusses Steps to Prevent Flood Damage
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Discusses Steps to Prevent Flood Damage 
						
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju made a field survey of the work to prevent flood damage.
					 Going round several places in Pyongyang and Nampho cities, he acquainted himself in detail with the dredging work in the River Taedong, the management of the sluice gates, etc., and held a consultative meeting.
					
					 The meeting discussed the issue to rationally adjust the water level of the river and increase the water passage ability so that flood damage do not occur.
					
					 The premier underlined the need for the relevant units to make real-time monitoring of the amount of the water flow and water level of the river and thoroughly establish an automatic controlling system for the sluice gates in order to protect the lives and properties of the people from flood and prevent natural damage in various fields of national economy.
					
					 Earlier, he learned about the fertilizer production at the Namhung Youth Chemical Complex and underscored the need to increase the production by scrupulously managing equipment and improving technical control.

articles.title: Japanese Dietmen's Delegation Leaves for Home
articles.content:
Japanese Dietmen's Delegation Leaves for Home
						
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- The Japanese dietmen's delegation led by Kanji Inoki, member of the House of Councilors, left here for home on Monday.

articles.title: Families of Chinese and Koreans Related to Anti-Japanese Revolutionary Struggle Leave
articles.content:
Families of Chinese and Koreans Related to Anti-Japanese Revolutionary Struggle Leave
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Families of Chinese and Koreans related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle left here on Monday.
					 They included the families of Chinese Liu Tong-shi, Fan Delin, Jiang Zihua and Shang Yue, and those of Koreans in China Kim Sun Ok and Ri Kwan Rin.
					
					 Leaving here earlier were Zhou Wei, daughter of Zhou Bao-zhong, and family of Sun Mingren, Chinese related to the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle, and family of Korean Li Zade, an anti-Japanese revolutionary fighter in China, and families of Koreans Pak Kil Song and Kim Chol, anti-Japanese revolutionary martyrs in China.

articles.title: Special Envoy of Mongolian President Here
articles.content:
Special Envoy of Mongolian President Here
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Khaltmaa Battulga, member of the State Great Hural of Mongolia who is the special envoy of the Mongolian president, and his party arrived here Monday. -0-

articles.title: Special Envoy of Mongolian President Pays Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Special Envoy of Mongolian President Pays Tribute to Statues of Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
						
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- The special envoy of the Mongolian president and his party laid bouquets before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Monday and paid tribute to them in humble reverence.

articles.title: North Hwanghae Provincial Maternity Hospital Appears
articles.content:
North Hwanghae Provincial Maternity Hospital Appears
 Sariwon, July 14 (KCNA) -- The North Hwanghae Provincial Maternity Hospital was successfully built.
					 The hospital covering a plottage of 10 000 square meters consists of wards for outpatient treatment and treatment of in-patients and annexes.
					
					 There are over 10 departments including delivery room and obstetrics, gynecology, functional diagnosis and breast tumour treatment.
					
					 Each room of the ward for treatment of in-patients has all amenities.
					
					 It has a large lawn and resting places clad in thick verdure of trees of good species, flowers and medical herbs.
					
					 The maternity hospital makes it possible to provide medical service to women at a high level and more satisfactorily ensure the birth of babies and their health.

articles.title: Achievements Made in Pomiculture of DPRK
articles.content:
Achievements Made in Pomiculture of DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- The DPRK made achievements in fruit farming in the first half of the year.
					 In the period farms under the Fruit Farming Guidance Bureau had concentrated efforts on expanding the orchards under a long-term plan and putting their manuring and cultivation on a scientific basis, Kim Chol Ho, director of a department of the Ministry of Agriculture, told KCNA, adding:
					
					 As a result, thousands of hectares of orchards were newly created through a drive to plant dwarf apple and other fruit trees in unoccupied fields and nurseries built for sharp persimmon, jujube and Korean vine.
					
					 And the farms introduced advanced farming methods and tended those orchards in a proper way, thus ensuring the rate of rooting at 90 percent.
					
					Practical steps were taken to ameliorate soil and improve the manuring method, while a brisk campaign was launched to introduce the agro-forestry management.
					
					 Besides, 10-odd new inventions were applied in the combat against harmful insects to ensure the smooth growth of fruit trees and raise the rate of actual fruit yield to the maximum.
					
					 Those fruit farms are now striving to improve the quality of fruits.

articles.title: Beaches in Rason City of DPRK Draw Tourists
articles.content:
Beaches in Rason City of DPRK Draw Tourists
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Beaches in Rason City, the DPRK has attracted a large number of tourists nowadays.
					 Sea off Rason is famous for crystal-like water and beautiful scenery. In the city there are such scenic beaches as Chujin, Pipha and Kalumdan.
					
					 Chinese tourists spent two nights and three days at the Kalumdan beach from July 12. They had enjoyable time, bathing, angling and taking roasted seafood.
					
					 Their tour was made under an agreement between the Rason International Travel Company and the Yanbian Spring International Travel Agency in Jilin Province, China.

articles.title: New Type of Prospecting Apparatus Developed in DPRK
articles.content:
New Type of Prospecting Apparatus Developed in DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Chaek University of Technology in the DPRK developed a CT direct current electro prospecting apparatus for underground resources, which is now popular among collieries and mines of the country.
					 This prospecting apparatus helps ensure the delimitation of orebody and the delineation of ore deposits even 150 meters underground. It can be also used in survey of base for building.
					
					 It played a significant role in developing geothermal water for the Ryugyong Health Complex, the People's Open-air Ice Rink and the Munsu Water Park.
					
					 The apparatus has been introduced to coal mines in Kangdong and Kaechon areas of the country, paying off profusely.

articles.title: Endless Stream of People Visit Chilgol Revolutionary Site
articles.content:
Endless Stream of People Visit Chilgol Revolutionary Site
						
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- The Chilgol Revolutionary Site is visited by 28.8 million service personnel, people from all walks of life, school youth and children, foreigners and overseas compatriots during six decades since it was built on July 17, Juche 43 (1954).
					 The site is the place where President Kim Il Sung nurtured his great intention to liberate the country by covering the 250-mile journey for learning and Kang Pan Sok, an outstanding leader of the Korean women's movement, was born and spent her childhood.
					
					 They paid tribute to the statues of the President and Kang Pan Sok in humblest reverence.
					
					 They looked round with keen interest the revolutionary relics and data.
					
					 Many foreigners and overseas compatriots visited the site vividly showing the noble patriotic intention and popular personality of the President and his revolutionary family members.

articles.title: Severe Drought Persists in DPRK
articles.content:
Severe Drought Persists in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- A long spell of severe drought continues in the DPRK.
					 According to data available, North and South Hwanghae, South Hamgyong, Kangwon and North and South Phyongan provinces and Pyongyang City have witnessed 84-220 mm rainfall, only 28-54 percent of the average, from January to July 13.
					
					 In particular, the rainfall reached 28-45 percent of the average in all eastern and western coastal areas, including Yonbaek, Jaeryong, Hamhung and Yoldusamcholli plains.
					
					 The average temperature in the period was 9-10.4 degrees centigrade, 1.4 to1.8 degrees higher than the average.
					
					 Yonbaek, Hamhung and Onchon plains and farmland in Thaethan County have been badly damaged by severe drought.
					
					 Measures have been taken to prevent drought damage in all parts of the country.

articles.title: Chongryon Officials Back Patriotic Desire of DPRK Government
articles.content:
Chongryon Officials Back Patriotic Desire of DPRK Government
						
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Officials of organizations of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan issued statements on July 9 in support of the statement of the DPRK government.
					 Kang Chu Ryon, chairperson of the Central Standing Committee of the Korean Democratic Women's Union in Japan, said that the statement released by the DPRK government on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of the last signature put by President Kim Il Sung to the historic document related to national reunification in his lifetime  is the patriotic proposal for national reunification as it proposes taking practical steps to bring about a new turning phase of the independent reunification of the country.
					
					 Ri Tong Je, chairman of the Association of Koreans in Japan for Peaceful Reunification, said that the south Korean authorities should positively respond to the statement of the DPRK government as it clarified its principled stand with its noble sense of responsibility for paving a wide avenue for improving the north-south relations and achieving the independent reunification of the country.
					
					 Ri Jong Man, managing director of the Standing Council of the Korean Federation of Workers in Commerce in Japan, declared that all officials and businessmen belonging to the organization would remain loyal to the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un and turn out in the nationwide struggle to bring about a new turning phase of the independent reunification of the country, the long-cherished desire of the Korean nation.
					
					 Kim Yong Ju, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the Korean Youth League in Japan, expressed the determination of the youth and students in Japan to unite close in the spirit of By Our Nation Itself in order to take the lead in the sacred struggle to translate into reality the offer of the DPRK government for national reunification, reflecting the patriotic desire and soul for national reunification, the long-cherished desire of the Korean nation.
					
					 Ri Yong Su, chairman of the Korean Social Scientists Association in Japan, said that the statement of the DPRK government calling for bringing about a new turning phase of improving the inter-Korean ties and achieving national reunification is a fair and aboveboard proposal which no Korean should deny.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Creating Korean Speed
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Creating Korean Speed
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- "Let's outpace the world at Korean speed!" and "Let's race against time, creating the Korean speed!" are the militant slogans put up by the Workers' Party of Korea at present, says Rodong Sinmun in an editorial on Monday.
					 It goes on:
					
					 It is the shining tradition of the DPRK to make an uninterrupted leap forward by creating a new speed of advance in socialist construction.
					
					 The DPRK has made the most shining history in its development by bringing about epoch-making changes under such watchwords as Chollima speed, Pyongyang speed, the speed of the 1980s and the speed of Huichon.
					
					 The new Korean speed represents the unanimous desire and militant goal of the service personnel and people of the DPRK.
					
					 Radical changes are taking place in the traits and work style of the people and new legends about dramatic turns are told in different parts of the country. These are the stirring realities of the country.
					
					 Whatever the party determined to do has become a reality. It is the revolutionary mettle of the Korean people to carry out at a lightning speed what the party calls on them to do.
					
					 It is the great courage of the Korean people not only to fight against imperialism to the bitter end for the dignity of the independent people and the destiny of socialism but to outpace the world and jump higher and advance faster.
					
					 The leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un, peerless statesman and genius of creation and construction, serves as an inspiring banner for the campaign for creating the new speed of Korea.
					
					 The daily calls upon all service personnel and people to add shine to the glorious tradition that they made uninterrupted leap forward in the spirit of the speed campaign at the Chollima speed and intensify the drive for creating the Korean speed in the new century of Juche and thus dynamically accelerate the general advance for the final victory.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Achieving Reunification by Federal Formula
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Achieving Reunification by Federal Formula
						
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- The DPRK set forth the realistic and just proposal for founding the Democratic Federal Republic of Koryo based on one nation, one state, two systems and two governments more than three decades ago.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday says in an article:
					
					 This was prompted by the noble pro-reunification patriotic will of the DPRK that the reunification issue related to the destiny of the nation should not be delayed any longer, while putting aside the differing ideologies and social systems.
					
					 The above-said proposal for building a reunified state is the most realistic, fair and reasonable one acceptable to all classes, strata, parties and groups in the north and the south as it makes it possible to achieve the peaceful reunification of the country.
					
					 Through the historic June 15 joint declaration the north and the south recognized the commonness in the north side's proposal for low-level federation and the south side's proposal for confederation and agreed to work for reunification in this direction in the future.
					
					 As agreed in the June 15 joint declaration, the north and the south should specify the joint proposal for reunification and make efforts to carry it out and thus actively promote co-existence, co-prosperity and common interests.
					
					 If the reunification is achieved by federal formula, the nation will establish sovereignty throughout the country and achieve the great unity as a homogenous nation and it will emerge an independent and peace-loving reunified state.
					
					 The reunification by federal formula will make a positive contribution to defusing the danger of a war on the Korean peninsula and ensuring peace and security in Northeast Asia.
					
					 The reunification by federal formula is the most reasonable way for the north and the south to reunify the country in a peaceful way and achieve the co-prosperity of the nation in conformity with the will and wishes of all Koreans, no  matter how the situation and circumstances may change.

articles.title: U.S. Urged to Roll Back Its Hostile Policy towards DPRK
articles.content:
U.S. Urged to Roll Back Its Hostile Policy towards DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- The U.S. remains unchanged in its hostile policy towards the DPRK and it is now being amended and supplemented with harsher substance with each passing day, says  Rodong Sinmun Monday in an article.
					 The present U.S. ruling quarters would be well advised to recollect what a bitter cup of setback the former Bush administration drank while taking a wrong approach towards the DPRK with a twisted way of thinking.
					
					 The Bush administration openly revealed its intention to antagonize the DPRK and isolate and stifle it, the article says and goes on:
					
					 The DPRK had legal and legitimate access to nuclear weapons to protect the sovereignty of the country and the national security from the U.S. nuclear threat getting evermore undisguised.
					
					 The U.S. should have drawn a due lesson from the baneful consequences of its hostile policy towards the DPRK, though belatedly.
					
					 However, the U.S. made the same mistake, failing to draw a proper lesson from its failed hostile policy towards the DPRK after its chief executive was replaced by the other.
					
					 The Obama administration has made desperate efforts to stifle the DPRK by floating the "rumor of collapse" of its social system, something that will never happen.
					
					 The U.S. knew nothing about the spirit and mettle of the army and people who were dashing ahead like the wind towards a thriving nation by dint of single-minded unity.
					
					 There are only two options for the U.S.
					
					 The first is to make a bold switchover in the Cold War mentality and roll back its anachronistic hostile policy towards the DPRK to contribute to the peace and security on the Korean peninsula and ensure the security of the U.S., too.
					
					 The second is to persist in its hostile policy as now. In this case it will compel the DPRK to reinforce its nuclear arsenal.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Discloses U.S. Ulterior Intention to Sell Latest Weapons to S. Korea
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Discloses U.S. Ulterior Intention to Sell Latest Weapons to S. Korea
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Recently the U.S. sold more than 360 shells called CBU-105 worth about 200 million U.S. dollars to south Korea. They are reportedly capable of destroying armored vehicles. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 The U.S. claims that the massive sale of latest weaponry to south Korea is to "deter" nuclear weapons and missiles of the DPRK. This is, however, nothing but sheer sophism to justify its criminal deployment or selling of weapons and give a shot in the arm of south Korea running helter-skelter, squeezed among big powers. 
					
					 The final aim of the U.S.  hostile policy toward the DPRK is a war of aggression. It is its calculation to continue using south Korea as a shock brigade for a war against the DPRK and ignite an actual war any moment. 
					
					 It seeks to ceaselessly stockpile latest weapons for a preemptive attack on the DPRK and potential enemies in south Korea, its forward arsenal, and use them at once when a proper time comes in a bid to bring the disaster of a new nuclear war to Northeast Asia and the Asia-Pacific region. 
					
					 To this end, the U.S. is frequently staging dangerous war drills to escalate the tension on the Korean peninsula. 
					
					 The U.S. is planning to stage a "drill to intercept planes" with south Korea from mid July and Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military drill in August. 
					
					 Herein lie the danger and gravity of the U.S. massive deployment and sale of weapons to south Korea. Consequently, the Korean peninsula and the Asia-Pacific region have become the biggest hotspot in the world. 
					
					 The U.S. is sadly mistaken if it calculates it will go safe when it lets the above-said arsenal go off. 
					
					 It should bear in mind that this case will bring its self-destruction.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary Reveals U.S. Scheme in Spreading Story about "Threat" from DPRK
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary Reveals U.S. Scheme in Spreading Story about "Threat" from DPRK
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- The chairman of the U.S. Joint Chiefs of Staff recently cried out for "finding out ways for cooperation to cope with threats from north Korea" amid the growing fear among American politicians over the progress made in the DPRK-Japan relations.
					 This is a revelation of the black-hearted design of the U.S. to keep spreading the stereotyped story about "threat from north Korea" and use it for realizing its strategy for dominating Asia-Pacific.
					
					 The U.S. is at jitters over the situation in Northeast Asia as it develops against its will.
					
					 It blames the DPRK's tactical rocket launching drills but it is the movement of its allies that it is most concerned about.
					
					 For example, Japan is now engrossed in dialogue and cooperation for improving relations with the DPRK at the moment.
					
					 These movements are supported by the international community as they are in line with the interests of the peoples of the two countries and in conformity with the desire for regional peace and stability.
					
					 But the U.S. is putting sort of pressure on Japan, urging it to "maintain transparency in dialogue with north Korea".
					
					 Its calculation is that the improvement of the DPRK-Japan relations can have an adverse effect on strengthening the alliance for aggression spearheaded by it.
					
					 Washington seeks to use Japan and south Korea as a shock brigade in executing its strategy for domination of Asia-Pacific. It, at the same time, regards the DPRK as the first target to stifle in executing its domination strategy and a pretext for covering up its hegemonic scenario.
					
					 It is for this reason that the U.S. has long instigated its allies to escalate confrontation, while describing the DPRK's just measures for self-defence as "threats" to regional stability.
					
					 It is against this backdrop that the chairman of the U.S. Joint Chiefs of Staff blustered that the DPRK's measure of bolstering up a military deterrence "highlights the importance of tri-partite cooperation".
					
					 It seems that the U.S. finds it hard to invent more plausible pretext than the story about "threat from north Korea" for instigating its allies into the aggression moves.
					
					 But its hackneyed trick will not work today.
					
					 The U.S. should clearly know that with nothing can it cover up its wild hegemonic ambition.

articles.title: DPRK-targeted Joint War Exercises under Fire in S. Korea
articles.content:
DPRK-targeted Joint War Exercises under Fire in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Many civic and social organizations in the area of Pusan held a press conference in front of the naval base in Pusan on July 11 in protest against the war exercises for aggression scheduled to stage with U.S. imperialist aggressor forces, according to Thongil News, an internet paper of south Korea.
					 At the press conference, the organizations accused the warmongers of the U.S., south Korea and Japan of being going to stage joint naval maneuvers in south Korea with aircraft carrier George Washington involved at a time when Tokyo is showing its increased moves to allow its exercise of the "right to collective self-defense".
					
					 This is an act of threatening peace on the Korean peninsula, they charged.
					
					 They urged the U.S. to stop at once the moves to escalate the tension through their military drills against the north.
					
					 They held that the south Korean authorities should stop the joint military drills with the U.S. and Japan and opt for dialogue and cooperation with the north.

articles.title: Abolition of "Law on Supervision for Public Peace" Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Abolition of "Law on Supervision for Public Peace" Demanded in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Progress, the Family Movement for Realizing Democracy and the Association for Supporting Prisoners of Conscience of the Family Movement for Realizing Democracy of south Korea at a press conference in Seoul on July 11 demanded the abolition of the "Law on supervision for public peace", according to the south Korean internet paper Thongil News.
					 The organizations in a press release said that Choe Ki Yong who had served three and a half years in jail on the charge of involvement in the case of the Ilsim Society was sentenced to forced labor from July 7 for the mere reason that he was not subject to the administrative punishment under the law.
					
					 This action was taken against him for failing to pay a fine of 800 000 won imposed upon him for his failure to inform police of his movements, subject to supervision for public peace. Choe is now on a hunger strike in a prison in Seoul in protest against this, the press release said, adding:
					
					 The law is an evil law forcing ideological conversion on people and violating their freedom of conscience as it originates from the "order for the probation of Korean political offenders" in the period of the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule over Korea. 
					
					 The press release urged the abolition of the law and release of Choe at once.

articles.title: S. Korean Police Suppression of KCTU Assailed
articles.content:
S. Korean Police Suppression of KCTU Assailed
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) held a press conference in Seoul on July 10 and denounced the authorities for suppressing its core members.
					 Speakers at the conference said the Seoul District Police Agency searched the houses of the former chairman for reunification of the KCTU and the incumbent director for reunification of the KCTU.
					
					 The public security authorities charged that a book they openly published two years ago was in violation of the "Security Law", the speakers said, adding the present "government" has kicked up the coloring racket against the organization to tide over the crisis.
					
					 Finding it impossible to prove the charge with the controversial book alone, the police stormed their houses early in the morning when their families were still asleep, a human rights abuse aimed to find out another charge, speakers held.
					
					 The suppression by the present regime can never be pardoned, they warned.
					
					 Suppression will only worsen crisis and invite ruin, they stressed.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Blasts Cabinet Reshuffle
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Blasts Cabinet Reshuffle
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet newspaper Voice of People in an editorial on July 11 denounced the south Korean authorities' personnel policy.
					 Two candidates for "prime minister" were forced to withdraw their candidacy even before confirmation hearings in south Korea. In its wake Jong Hong Won who had left his office earlier was brought back to the post of "prime minister" to become a laughing stock of the world, the editorial said, and went on:
					
					 Greater irony is the appointment of ministers as the records of scandals committed by candidates for ministers disclosed at confirmation hearings were stunning.
					
					 People remained bewildered when Jong cried out for forming an all-people committee for "reforms" after returning to the prime minister's office though he had been ousted for his responsibility for the ferry Sewol disaster.
					
					 What is so shocking is that the regime is thinking of letting the man responsible for the disaster spearhead the "reform" at a time when the truth behind the disaster has not been probed.
					
					 By carrying out the Cabinet reshuffle the present regime is ignoring the lesson taught by the April 16 disaster that everything has to be changed. The Cabinet reshuffle is a provocation to the people.

articles.title: Korean in U.S. Praises Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Korean in U.S. Praises Kim Il Sung
						
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- An article written by Kim Hyon Hwan, director of the Institute of Independent Ideology in Americas, was posted on the website of the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung. 
					 The article said:
					
					 President Kim Il Sung built an independent socialist country in the northern half of Korea guided by the Juche idea centered on the people.
					
					 This was his great contribution to the human history.
					
					 Human beings desire an independent life while being masters of the world and their destiny free from any fetters and subjugation. 
					
					 The north, the Juche-oriented socialist country centered on human beings and people, institutionally guarantees this desire.
					
					 The author accused the imperialist forces opposed to socialism of declaring that they would not rule out even a war against the countries and nations taking the road of independence and socialism.
					
					 Guided by the people-centered Juche idea and the idea of attaching importance to arms, the President turned the DPRK into an impregnable fortress which the imperialist forces including the U.S. dare not invade.
					
					 He dedicated himself to national reunification till the last moments of his great life, saying that a reunified country was the biggest gift to be presented to the fellow countrymen.
					
					 He was, indeed, a great man who indicated the path of independent Juche-oriented socialism centered on the people, the road to be followed by humankind.
					
					 The fellow countrymen are sure to achieve the reunification of Korea by following the road of independence, the Juche-oriented one of socialism.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Kuwait
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Published in Kuwait
						
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "The Great Kim Il Sung Is the Eternal Leader of Our Party and Our People" was brought out in booklet by the Kuwait Times Publishing House.
					 The work published on April 20, Juche 101 (2012) deals with the revolutionary exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in their lifetimes.
					
					 It indicates the tasks for firmly upholding and preserving the idea and exploits of the President and Kim Jong Il and eternally glorifying them.
					
					 A book-releasing ceremony took place at the publishing house on July 7.

articles.title: Desire of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for Building Thriving Nation Sure to Come True: Kuwaiti Figures
articles.content:
Desire of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for Building Thriving Nation Sure to Come True: Kuwaiti Figures
						
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- The desire of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il for building a thriving nation is sure to come true under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					 The chairman of the Kuwaiti Committee for Remembering President Kim Il Sung said this at the ceremony of releasing Kim Jong Un's work held at the Kuwait Times Publishing House on July 7.
					
					 He said:
					
					 Today the DPRK is upholding the idea and exploits of the preceding leaders and further glorifying them under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 I pray for the eternal life of the President and wish Kim Jong Un good health and success in his work.
					
					 The chief for sale of the above-said publishing house wished the Korean people greater victory in their struggle for defending the country's sovereignty and stability and achieving its prosperity, noting that he would carry more articles supporting the Korean people in their just struggle for guaranteeing peace and security and reunifying the country in future.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Remembered in Foreign Countries
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Remembered in Foreign Countries
						
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Remembrance meetings took place in Russia, Bulgaria, Hungary and Slovenia on July 7 on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Present there were figures of the Russian Blagobeshensk Association for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, Blagobeshensk State University of Education, Bulgarian Communists Union, Bulgaria－Korea Friendship Association, Kim Il Sung Library in Sofia, Bulgaria, Hungarian Workers' Party and the Slovenia-Korea Friendship Association and masses.
					
					 A. I. Donchenko, chairman of the Russian Blagobeshensk Association for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, said:
					
					 President Kim Il Sung is always alive in the hearts of not only the Korean people but humankind as the outstanding leader representing the 20th century. 
					
					 He was the great master of idea and theory who ushered in the era of independence and guaranteed the victorious advance of the cause of independence by founding the Juche idea and the Songun idea.
					
					 He led the cause of global independence against imperialism to victory, holding aloft the banner of Juche all his life.
					
					 Maria Angelova, acting head of Kim Il Sung Library in Sofia, said that the President is being deeply revered not only by the Korean people but by the world progressive people as the political elder of the 20th century who made undying contributions to the cause of independence against imperialism and the global cause of socialism.
					
					 Gyula Thurmer, chairman of the Hungarian Workers' Party who doubles as chairman of the Hungarian Committee for Remembering President Kim Il Sung, and other speakers said that the President would live forever in the hearts of the world people for his noble exploits performed in the struggle for accomplishing the human cause of independence.

articles.title: Kimilsungia Show Held in Guinea
articles.content:
Kimilsungia Show Held in Guinea
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- A Kimilsungia show took place in Guinea on July 5 in commemoration of the 20th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 On display at the venue of the show were photos documenting the exploits of the peerless great men.
					
					 Displayed there were potted Kimilsungias in full bloom reflecting the boundless reverence of the Guinean people for the President.
					
					 Guinean personages of various circles and masses were present there. Present there on invitation were staff members of the DPRK embassy in Conakry and officials of the relevant institutions.
					
					 Riyad Chaloub, chairman of the Guinean National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea who doubles as chairman of the Guinean Committee for Remembering President Kim Il Sung, said that the President was the most outstanding leader representing the 20th century, peerless great man and great sage of humankind.
					
					 He went on: Many people in the world are highly praising the immortal exploits and noble traits of the President.
					
					 Immortal flower Kimilsungia is widely propagated in the world.
					
					 The idea and cause of the President will last forever.
					
					 The vice-chairman of the Guinean Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Association said that Kimilsungia is holding an unchallenged position as a famous flower recognized by the world horticulture and treasure common to humankind.
					
					 He stressed that it is quite natural that many people praising and revering the President are attracted by the profound meaning of Kimilsungia and its beauty.

articles.title: Foreign Papers Praise Kim Il Sung's Exploits
articles.content:
Foreign Papers Praise Kim Il Sung's Exploits
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Foreign papers carried special write-ups illustrated with portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, and their photos and those of Marshal Kim Jong Un on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of demise of the President.
					 The July 7th issue of the Lao paper Vientiane Mai, the July 7-13th issue of the Lao paper Heng Ngan and the June 30th issue of the Mexican paper Unidad Nacional carried articles introducing the revolutionary career of the President under such titles as "Brilliant life of Comrade Kim Il Sung and his immortal exploits" and "Outstanding leader in the 20th century."
					
					 The July 2nd issue of the paper of DR Congo La Prosperite carried articles entitled "Father of people", "Great model of international cooperation" and "Kim Jong Un, great successor" under the headline of "Eternal President of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea."
					
					 The July 4th  issue of the Ugandan paper Sun Rise in an article titled "For global independence" said that the President set forth the outstanding idea, theories, strategies and tactics for global independence and rendered material and moral assistance to the people of many countries in their struggle for national liberation and the building of a new society.
					
					 An Angolan paper on July 4 also carried articles titled "DPRK remembering the sun" and subtitled "In memory of eternal sun President Kim Il Sung" introducing his ideological and theoretical feats and leadership exploits, noting he is deeply revered by the Korean people and the world progressive people as the eternal sun.
					
					 The July 5th issue of the Libyan paper February carried articles captioned "On the occasion of the 20th anniversary of demise of eternal President Kim Il Sung of Korean people" and "Outstanding great man in the century."

articles.title: Book "President Kim Il Sung and Finland" Published in Finland
articles.content:
Book "President Kim Il Sung and Finland" Published in Finland
						
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Book "President Kim Il Sung and Finland" was brought out in Finland on the occasion of the 20th anniversary of his demise.
					 Its releasing ceremony took place in Helsinki on July 6.
					
					 Present there were personages of the Communist Workers' Party of Finland for the Peace and Socialism, the Finnish Communists' League, the Finnish National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea, the Finland-Korea Society and other political parties and organizations and masses.
					
					 Antti Sika Aho, chairman of the Finland-Korea Society who authored the book, said:
					
					 I am honored to release the book. The President paid deep attention to the struggle of the Finnish people and led them.
					
					 He cordially received the Finnish figures during their visit to the DPRK and took warm care of them.
					
					 Many Finnish people are praising his greatness.
					
					 I hope that the book will help develop the friendly relations between Finland and the DPRK.

articles.title: British Organizations Mark Anniversary of July 4 Joint Statement
articles.content:
British Organizations Mark Anniversary of July 4 Joint Statement
						
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Progressive organizations of Britain including the British-Korea Friendship Association made public a joint statement on July 4 on the occasion of the  42nd anniversary of the July 4 joint statement.
					 The publication of the July 4 joint statement was the precious fruition of the outstanding idea of President Kim Il Sung on national reunification and his wise leadership, the statement noted, and went on:
					
					 The Park Geun Hye fascist authorities of south Korea are desperately disturbing the efforts to improve the inter-Korean relations and suppressing the pro-reunification progressive patriotic forces.
					
					 Park Geun Hye, in particular, is negating the July 4 joint statement with anti-reunification sophism.
					
					 The basic principles of national reunification clarified by Kim Il Sung in the July 4 joint statement are fully reflected in the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration provided by leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They are also clarified in the special proposal sent by the National Defence Commission of the DPRK to the south Korean authorities recently.
					
					 If the south Korean authorities truly want the reunification of Korea, they should stop the war drills against the north and the nexus with foreign forces.
					
					 We are convinced that the Korean people will reunify the country without fail on the principle of independence under the guidance of Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Praised by Swiss Organizations
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Praised by Swiss Organizations
						
 Pyongyang, July 14 (KCNA) -- Human history records not a few great men who earned fame but there was no such a great man as President Kim Il Sung.
					 The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea said this in a joint statement on July 3.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The exploits performed by the President in the whole period of his revolutionary life were unprecedented in human history.
					
					 He was the greatest-ever commander who founded the immortal Juche idea and the Songun idea and defeated the U.S. and Japanese imperialists in one generation.
					
					 He organized the anti-Japanese armed struggle, putting an end to the Japanese imperialists' colonial rule over Korea and liberating it.
					
					 He founded the DPRK, the first independent and sovereign state in liberated Korea, and led the great Fatherland Liberation War to victory, bringing about the beginning of decline for the U.S. imperialists, the first of its kind in history.
					
					 A land of bliss for the people was built in socialist Korea thanks to his wise leadership for decades in the post-war period.
					
					 He worked heart and soul for national reunification till the last moments of his life and provided a great programme for national reunification.
					
					 He dedicated himself to the people's happiness all his life.
					
					 He was a tender-hearted father of the people as he regarded believing in people as in Heaven as his motto.

articles.title: Pak Pong Ju toma medidas para prevenir danos por inundaciones
articles.content:
Pak Pong Ju toma medidas para prevenir danos por inundaciones
						
Pyongyang, 14 de julio (ACNC) -- El premier de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Pak Pong Ju, averiguo en el terreno las labores destinadas a prevenir los danos por inundacion.
					Recorriendo varios lugares de esta capital y la ciudad de Nampho, Pak hizo conocimientos detallados de la marcha del dragado del rio Taedong y del arreglo de esclusa y convoco una reunion consultiva.
					
					En la ocasion se debatieron los temas para controlar racionalmente el nivel del agua del rio Taedong y aumentar la capacidad de pase de agua, para que no surjan los danos por inundaciones.
					
					El premier destaco la necesidad de vigilar todo el tiempo la cantidad de corriente de agua y su nivel en el rio Taedong y establecer el sistema de control automatico de las esclusas a fin de proteger la vida y bienes del pueblo y prevenir los danos naturales en varias unidades de la economia nacional.
					
					Con anterioridad, el premier se cercioro del estado de produccion de abonos en el Complejo Quimico Juventud de Hamhung y exhorto a aumentar la produccion al hacer bien la administracion de equipos y tecnologia.

articles.title: Construida la casa de maternidad de provincia de Hwanghae del Norte
articles.content:
Construida la casa de maternidad de provincia de Hwanghae del Norte
						
Sariwon, 14 de julio (ACNC) -- Quedo construida la casa de maternidad de la provincia de Hwanghae del Norte.
					Ella tiene una superficie de 10 mil metros cuadrados y consta del pabellon externo de curacion, el de hospitalizacion y los edificios anexos.
					
					Ademas de la sala de parto, hay 10 secciones especializadas en la obstetricia, ginecologia, diagnostico funcional y tumor mamario, etc.
					
					En cada habitacion de las pacientes se facilitan todas las condiciones para el confort. 
					
					En el recinto de la casa hay las areas verdes y sitios de descanso.
					
					El nuevo centro asistencial garantiza el alto nivel de servicios medicos para la poblacion femenina preparando mejores condiciones de nacimiento y salud de los bebes.

articles.title: Exitos en fruticultura de RPDC
articles.content:
Exitos en fruticultura de RPDC
Pyongyang, 14 de julio (ACNC) -- Fueron  logrados exitos durante el primer semestre en el sector de fruticultura de Corea.
					El director del Ministerio de Agricultura, Kim Chol Ho, dijo a la ACNC que las granjas subordinadas a la Direccion de Fruticultura se esforzaron para hacer de modo cientifico y tecnico la formacion de campos de frutales y el abonamiento y cuidado de los cultivos, y continuo:
					
					Gracias al esfuerzo por formar con vistas al futuro los huertos frutales y plantar en todas las tierras desocupadas las posturas de arboles frutales, se crearon mas miles de hectareas de frutales.
					
					Se crearon los campos de manzanos de baja altura y las bases de produccion de posturas de caqui conico, azufaifa Kuwol y uva coreana.
					
					En las granjas se introdujeron los metodos agricolas cientificos y el mejor abonamiento y cuidado de los cultivos, asi que se aseguro mas de 90 por ciento la proporcion de radicacion de arboles.
					
					Se tomaron las medidas practicas por la mejora de la tierra y se mejoro el  metodo de abono en la profundidad.
					
					Se desplego la labor por introducir el metodo de la administracion combinada de la agro-selvicultura.
					
					Se introdujeron en la exterminacion de enfermedades e insectos nocivos mas de 10 exitos de nuevas investigaciones y se aumentaron al maximo en las unidades el crecimiento y la tasa de fruta almibarada de arboles frutales abonando productos agroquimicos producidos con las fuerzas propias.
					
					En estos dias, en las granjas fruticolas se toman las medidas para mejorar la calidad de los frutos.

articles.title: Se activa turismo de tienda de campana en playas de Rason
articles.content:
Se activa turismo de tienda de campana en playas de Rason
						
Pyongyang, 14 de julio (ACNC) -- En estos dias, en las playas de la ciudad de Rason de Corea se activa el turismo de tiendas de campana.
					Esto es el turismo para hacer de dia y de noche bano en el mar, paseo y pesca con cana instalando en la playa las tiendas de campana.
					
					En la ciudad de Rason hay playas pintorescas  como las de Chujin y Pipha.
					
					Segun el acuerdo entre la Agencia de Viaje Internacional de Rason y la Agencia Internacional de Viaje Primavera de Yanbian de la provincia de Jilin de China, tuvo lugar del 12 al 14 el turismo de tienda de campana de 2 noches y 3 dias. 
					
					Los turistas pasaron el tiempo alegre visitando de dia la ciudad de Rason, nadando de noche en la playa de Kalumdan y saboreando el asado de marisco, calamar y otros productos maritimos.
